none: Northwestern University Marching Band Compilation Video
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University Video Cassette Collection--Northwestern University Marching Band Highlights
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
How the West was won (Motion picture)

Highlights from the 1998 Northwestern University Marching Band season. Highlights begin with the pregame performance at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Ryan Field in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare," "Hail Purdue," "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime show from the October 3, 1998 game against the Fighting Illini features a wild west theme and includes the theme from "How the West Was Won" and "Hoe-Down" from Aaron Copland's "Rodeo." Mallory Thompson conducts "Alma Mater." Due to weather conditions during the October 17, 1998 game against the Michigan Wolverines, the Northwestern University University Marching Band did not perform the halftime show on the field. The footage includes the band performing "Hail to the Victors," "Go U Northwestern," and "March of the Steelmen." Mallory Thompson conducts "Alma Mater." The theme of the halftime show from the October 24, 1998 game against the Ohio State Buckeyes was Motown. The Northwestern University Marching Band's performances include "Ain't No Mountain High Enough," "I Can't Help Myself," "I'll Be There," "Baby I Need Your Loving," "I Heard It Through the Grapevine," "Dancing In the Street," "Get Ready," "My Girl," and "For Once In My Life." The halftime show from the November 7, 1998 game against the Purdue Boilermakers salutes alumni from Northwestern's first appearance in the Rose Bowl of 1949 and includes the "Kicking Man" and a performance of "My Hero." Other performances include "Hoe-Down" from Aaron Copland's "Rodeo" and "March of the Steelmen." Senior members of the band are recognized, and "Alma Mater" is performed. A highlight of the 1998 season is when the Northwestern University Marching Band appears on the WGN-TV morning news on October 15, 1998. Director of Bands Rodney Dorsey is interviewed and previews the upcoming Homecoming Game salute to the 1949 alumni. The band performs cheers, "Hey Baby" and "Go U Northwestern." The program concludes with the band marching into WGN's studio. The highlights conclude with a pregame performance from the October 24, 1998 game against the Ohio State Buckeyes. Pregame performances by the Ohio State Marching Band include "Go U Northwestern" and "Buckeye Battle Cry."

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
